Detailed Description

Definitions for PPU-side Mailbox related functions and macros.

Note:
Most of the Mailbox functions initiated by PPU are non-blocking.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_MBOX_IN_MAX_ENTRIES   4

Max entries of nbound mbox

#define CTK_MBOX_IN_STAT_SHIFT   8

shift in the MboxStat

#define CTK_MBOX_OUT_INTR_MAX_ENTRIES   1

Max entries of outbound interrupt mbox

#define CTK_MBOX_OUT_INTR_STAT_SHIFT   16

shift in the MboxStat

#define CTK_MBOX_OUT_MAX_ENTRIES   1

Max entries of outbound mbox

#define CTK_MBOX_OUT_STAT_SHIFT   0

shift in the MboxStat

Function Documentation

int ctk_intr_mbox_read ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
ctk_uint32_t *  data 
)

Reads the contents of the SPU outbound mailbox for the given SPE. [Non-blocking] This read is non-blocking and returns CTK_ERROR_NO_DATA if no mailbox data is available.

See also:
ctk_intr_mbox_read_block for blocking call
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose outbound intr mailbox is to be read.
[in] data - the value of the Mailbox.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_intr_mbox_read_block ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
ctk_uint32_t *  data 
)

Reads the contents of the SPU outbound interrupt mailbox for the given SPE. This blocks if the mailbox is empty. [Blocking]

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose outbound interrupt mailbox is to be read.
[out] data - the value of the Mailbox.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_intr_mbox_read_count ( ctk_spe_t  spe  ) 

Gets the count of the unread entries of the SPU outbound interrupt mailbox for the given SPE.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose outbound interrupt mailbox is to be examined.
Returns:
the number of (32-bit) unread mailbox entries (>= 0). A 0 value indicates the mailbox is empty. On failure, -errno is returned (< 0).

int ctk_mbox_read ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
ctk_uint32_t *  data 
)

Reads the contents of the SPU outbound mailbox for the given SPE. [Non-blocking] This read is non-blocking and returns CTK_ERROR_NO_DATA if no mailbox data is available.

See also:
ctk_mbox_read_block for blocking call
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose outbound mailbox is to be read.
[out] data - the value of the Mailbox.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_mbox_read_block ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
ctk_uint32_t *  data 
)

Reads the contents of the SPU outbound mailbox for the given SPE. This blocks if the mailbox is empty. [Blocking]

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose outbound mailbox is to be read.
[out] data - the value of the Mailbox.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_mbox_read_count ( ctk_spe_t  spe  ) 

Gets the count of unread entries of the SPU outbound mailbox for the given SPE.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose outbound mailbox is to be examined.
Returns:
the number of unread (32-bit) mailbox entries (>= 0). A 0 value indicates the mailbox is empty. On failure, -errno is returned (< 0).

int ctk_mbox_write ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
ctk_uint32_t  data 
)

Writes the 32-bit data specified by data into the SPU inbound mailbox for the given SPE. [Non-blocking] If the mailbox is full, then ctk_mbox_write may overwrite the last entry in the mailbox. The ctk_mbox_write_count function can be called to ensure the space is available prior to writing to the inbound mailbox.

See also:
ctk_mbox_write_block for blocking call
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose inbound mailbox is to be written.
[in] data - the value to be written.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_mbox_write_block ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
ctk_uint32_t  data 
)

Writes the 32-bit data specified by data into the SPU inbound mailbox for the given SPE. [Blocking] The call blocks if the mailbox is full.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose inbound mailbox is to be written.
[in] data - the value to be written.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno on failure.

int ctk_mbox_write_count ( ctk_spe_t  spe  ) 

Gets the count of empty data slots of the SPU inbound mailbox for the given SPE.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose inbound mailbox is to be examined.
Returns:
the number of (32-bit) empty (available) mailbox slots (>= 0). A 0 value indicates the mailbox is full. On failure, -errno is returned (< 0).
